books.name: (In progress) Reminiscences of a Stock Operator,  Edwin Lef√®vre (1923)
Rich dad, poor dad, Robert Kiyosaki
Either/Or: A fragment of life, Soren Kierkegaard
Karamazov Brothers, Fyodor Dostoyevsky (1879)
books.review: Above all, don't lie to yourself. The man who lies to himself and listens to his own lie comes to a point that he cannot distinguish the truth within him, or around him, and so loses all respect for himself and for others. And having no respect he ceases to love.

books.name: The Making of Prince of Persia, Jordan Mechner
books.review: 25 year old developer who goes through the everyday struggles of life while maintaining a diary. I haven't ever connected to an author as much as I connected with Jordan. He has exactly the same mid 20s questions, the same career-life-relationships worries, the what ifs, and the where am I going, whilst also knowing that he's really doing a fairly good job at life.

books.name: The Siege of Malta 1565, Francisco Balbi di Correggio (1567)
The Master and Margarita, Mikhail Bulgakov (1967)
books.review: Everything will turn out right, the world is built on that.

books.name: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn, Mark Twain
Fool's Crusade, Diana Johnstone
books.review: Read it as part of my research before travelling to ex Yugoslavia.
